articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces pressed their offensive in north and central Gaza on Wednesday, hours after an airstrike on a tent encampment that Palestinian officials said killed more than two dozen people and as negotiations to end the fighting were set to resume.
articles.title: Israel presses Gaza offensive hours after deadly airstrike on tent camp

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden and leaders of other NATO member states are poised to unveil new aid for war-ravaged Ukraine as they gather for their annual summit in Washington on Wednesday.
articles.title: Biden, NATO members poised to unveil new Ukraine aid at summit

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelinskiy returns to the U.S. capitol on Wednesday to cement relationships with lawmakers who will vote on future aid for his country, and thank them for $175 billion already approved since Russia invaded in February 2022.
articles.title: Zelenskiy returns to Washington, to say thanks, build relationships

articles.author: Benoit Van Overstraeten, Zhifan Liu
articles.description: Leaders from the left-wing bloc that topped France's legislative election on Sunday and the runner-up centrists continued on Wednesday a frenzied race to try to put together rival bids to form a viable government.
articles.title: French left and centrists tussle to form government

articles.author: Lisa Barrington
articles.description: North Korea's trash balloon campaign, missile launches and the emergence of GPS "spoofing" have increased risks in South Korean airspace, aviation experts say, complicating airline operations as tensions rise between the rival nations.
articles.title: North Korea balloons, GPS interference raise safety risks for airlines

articles.author: Krisztina Fenyo, Anita Komuves
articles.description: Hungarian opposition politician Peter Magyar, the main challenger to Prime Minister Viktor Orban, delivered aid on Wednesday to the Kyiv children's hospital hit during Russian airstrikes this week.
articles.title: Hungarian opposition leader delivers aid to damaged Kyiv children's hospital

articles.author: Panu Wongcha-Um, Panarat Thepgumpanat
articles.description: Thailand's Election Commission on Wednesday endorsed 200 new senators who will replace a military-appointed upper house, revealing a new legislative body that analysts say could make it harder for the embattled ruling Pheu Thai party to govern.
articles.title: Thailand announces new senate, replacing army-appointed lawmakers

articles.author: Lizbeth Diaz
articles.description: Mexican navy officials running the country's biggest port are increasingly concerned about the rising flows of unregulated "dual use" chemicals used to produce synthetic drugs such as methamphetamine and fentanyl, four Navy officials told Reuters.
articles.title: Mexico's navy warns dual use chemicals are boosting meth production

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia said on Wednesday that its military was still working to create a "buffer zone" in Ukraine's Kharkiv region but this would take time.
articles.title: Kremlin says creation of "buffer zone" in Ukraine needs time

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Approval of Brazil's President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva went up in July to the highest level in 2024, a poll showed on Wednesday, with most respondents having favorable views on his criticism of the central bank's interest rate policy.
articles.title: Approval of Brazil's Lula goes up in July with support on cenbank view, poll shows
